thread.title: Ringo Starr’s jacket from Beatles movie brings in over $46,000 at auction
thread.title_full: Ringo Starr’s jacket from Beatles movie brings in over $46,000 at auction - MarketWatch

author: By     Michelle Coffey
title: Ringo Starr’s jacket from Beatles movie brings in over $46,000 at auction
text:
The suit jacket Ringo Starr donned in the 1965 Beatles’ film “Help!” pulled in more than $46,000 dollars at a recent online auction that was also heavy on punk-rock memorabilia from artists such as the Ramones, the Clash and the Sex Pistols.
“As decades go by, memorabilia from these particular artists seems to resonate and get more valuable,” said Bobby Livingston, an executive vice president at Boston-based RR Auction, who sees baby boomers with plenty of disposable income tapping back into one of their legacies: rock 'n' roll.
Ringo’s double-breasted suit jacket with six black buttons was one of the roughly 500 items on the block at RR Auction’s Marvels of Modern Music auction in July. The jacket popped up briefly in the Beatles’ second film, “Help!,” which is also the first time the group appeared in color.
Here’s a look at the other top items, including a custom-designed guitar for Johnny Ramone and an album signed by Jimi Hendrix.
